definition: to lodge under another person's roof (idiom); to live relying on sb else's charity
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
a fence
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: I have never been praised nor belittled; I am below no one.
sentences.chinese: 可我既没受到赞扬也没受到贬低，因为我不寄人篱下。

sentences.english: Small Hei Yang lives ovine life, often sad weep.
sentences.chinese: 小黑羊过着寄人篱下的日子，经常伤心落泪。

sentences.english: You know the bitter taste of living under somebody else's thumb.
sentences.chinese: 你们知道，寄人篱下的生活是不好受的。

definition: to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to have lost both one's parents
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
solitary and impoverished (idiom)
to come down in the world (idiom)/to suffer a reversal of fortune
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to accept a compromise
to live one's life/to make a living
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
poor/poverty-stricken/impoverished
to be accustomed to (a certain lifestyle etc)
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
